The sorting algorithm sorts a given array in ascending order.

Input: An array of integers.
Output: Input array sorted in ascending order.
Test of correctness:     The execution of an algorithm for a given array is correct if array[i] ≤ array[j] holds for any pair of indeces i and j where 0 ≤i ≤ j ≤ array.size-1.
Implementation: To implement a sorting algorithm the author has to write a java class extending the SortAbsAlgorithm class
